sect2.title: Roxie Example: Anagram2
sect2.para: In this example, we will download an open source data file of dictionary words, spray that file to our Thor cluster, then validate our anagrams against that file so that we determine which are valid words. The validation step uses a JOIN of the anagram list to the dictionary file. Using an index and a keyed join would be more efficient, but this serves as a simple example.

sect3.title: Download the word list
sect3.para: We will download the word list from http://wordlist.aspell.net/12dicts

listitem.para: Download the Official 12 Dicts Package. The files are available in tar.gz or ZIP format.
Extract the package contents and save the 2of12.txt file (typically found in the American sub-folder) to a folder on your local machine.

sect3.title: Load the Dictionary File to your Landing Zone
sect3.para: In this step, you will copy the data files to a location from which it can be sprayed to your HPCC cluster. A Landing Zone is a storage location attached to your HPCC. It has a utility running to facilitate file spraying to a cluster.
For smaller data files, maximum of 2GB, you can use the upload/download file utility in ECL Watch. This data file is only ~400 kb.

Next you will distribute (or Spray) the dataset to all the nodes in the HPCC cluster. The power of the HPCC comes from its ability to assign multiple processors to work on different portions of the data file in parallel. Even though the VM Edition only has a single node, the data must be sprayed to the cluster.

listitem.para: In your browser, go to the ECL Watch URL. For example, http://nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn:8010, where nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn is your ESP Server's IP address.

row.entry: Your IP address could be different from the ones provided in the example images. Please use the IP address provided by your installation.

listitem.para: From ECL Watch click on the Files icon, then click the Landing Zones link from the navigation sub-menu.
Press the Upload action button.
A dialog opens. Browse to and select the file to upload and then press the Open button.
The file you selected should appear in the File Name field. The data file is named: 2of12.txt.
Press the Start button to complete the file upload.

sect3.title: Spray the Data File to your Data Refinery (Thor) Cluster
sect3.para: To use the data file in our HPCC system, we must "spray" it to all the nodes. A spray or import is the relocation of a data file from one location (such as a Landing Zone) to multiple file parts on nodes in a cluster.

The distributed or sprayed file is given a logical-file-name as follows: ~thor::word_list_csv The system maintains a list of logical files and the corresponding physical file locations of the file parts.

listitem.para: Open ECL Watch using the following URL:

para.emphasis: http://nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn:pppp(where nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn is your ESP Server's IP Address and pppp is the port. The default port is 8010)

listitem.para: Click on the Files icon, then click the Landing Zones link from the navigation sub-menu. Select the appropriate landing zone (if there are more than one landing zones). Click the arrow to the left of your landing zone to expand it.
Select the file from your drop zone by checking the box next to it.
Check the box next to 2of12.txt, then press the Delimited button.
The DFU Spray Delimited page displays.
Select mythor in the Target Group drop list.
Complete the Target Scope as thor.
Fill in the rest of the parameters (if they are not filled in already).
Max Record Length 8192
Separator \,
Line Terminator \n,\r\n
Quote: '
Fill in the Target Name using the rest of the Logical File name desired: word_list_csv
Make sure the Overwrite box is checked.
If available, make sure the Replicate box is checked. (The Replicate option is only available on systems where replication has been enabled.)
Press the Spray button.
A tab displays the DFU Workunit where you can see the progress of the spray.
Select thor as your target cluster.
Press the syntax check button on the main toolbar (or press F7)
Press the Submit button.
When it completes, select the Workunit tab, then select the Result tab.
Examine the result.

sect3.title: Compile and Publish the query to Roxie

listitem.para: Right-click on the My Files folder in the Repository window, and select Insert Folder from the pop-up menu.
Enter Anagram for the label, then press the OK button.
Right-click on the Anagram Folder, and select Insert File from the pop-up menu.
Enter ValidateAnagrams for the label, then press the OK button.
A Builder Window opens.
Select Roxie as your target cluster.
Press the syntax check button on the main toolbar (or press F7)
In the Builder window, in the upper left corner the Submit button has a drop down arrow next to it. Select the arrow to expose the Compile option.
Select Compile
When it completes, select the Workunit tab, then select the Result tab.
When the workunit finishes, it will display a green circle indicating it has compiled.

sect3.title: Publish the Roxie query
sect3.para: Next we will publish the query to a Roxie Cluster.

listitem.para: Select the workunit tab for the ValidateAnagrams that you just compiled.
Select the ECL Watch tab.
Press the Publish button, complete the dialog, and press Submit.

Publish Query
When it successfully publishes, a confirmation message displays.

sect3.title: Run the Roxie Query in WsECL
sect3.para: Now that the query is published to a Roxie cluster, we can run it using the WsECL service. WsECL is a web-based interface to queries on an HPCC platform. Use the following URL:

para.emphasis: http://nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn:pppp (where nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn is your ESP Server's IP address and pppp is the port. The default port is 8002)

listitem.para: Click on the + sign next to myroxie to expand the tree.
Click on the ValidateAnagrams.1 hyperlink.
The form for the service displays.
Select Output Tables in the drop list.
Provide a word to make anagrams from (e.g., TEACHER), then press the Submit button.
The results display.
